---
title: "Example 3"
description: "reference line and language parameter"
output: html_document
---

In addition to the YAML parameters shown in the previous examples, this letter displays some  additions needed for example when communicating with German administrations or agencies.

* `yourref`, `yourmail`, `myref` common parts of the reference line (German: Bezugszeichenzeile)
* image in `signature` to make it look like it was hand signed.
* `signature-before` is for fine tuning the vertical space between closing and signature.
* `lang` sets the language of the document which influences the labels of the reference line, date etc.. Requires the respective latex language pack (i.e texlive-lang-german).
* `papersize` sets the paper size (default: DIN A4).

<br>

### RMarkdown of Letter
```{r manip_example, include=FALSE}
ex <- readLines('letter_example3.Rmd')

# drop vignette lines
ex <- ex[!grepl('ignette', x=ex)]

# replace language line and kill comment above
idx <- grep("lang:", ex)
ex[idx] <- "lang: de"
ex <- ex[-(idx-1)]

# write to file for rmarkdown::render()
writeLines(ex, con="intermediate.Rmd")
```


```{r show-rmarkdown, code=ex, eval=FALSE, highlight=FALSE}

```

<br>

### Resulting PDF Letter

PDF rendered from the RMarkdown document above via `rmarkdown::render()` or RStudio Knit button.

```{r render-pdf, include=FALSE}
rmarkdown::render("intermediate.Rmd", output_file="pkgdown_ex3.pdf", output_dir='.')
pdftools::pdf_convert(pdf='pkgdown_ex3.pdf', dpi=200, format="jpeg", pages=1, filenames="pkgdown_ex3.jpg")
```
